intro: Tephrosia brachyodon var. multiflora, commonly known as the small-leaved tephrosia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa and Southeast Asia. It is a shrub or small tree that typically grows to a height of 1–3 meters, featuring compound leaves with small, oval-shaped leaflets. The plant produces small, clustered yellow flowers that bloom throughout the year, attracting various pollinators. Its roots contain compounds with insecticidal properties, making it valuable in traditional agriculture and pest control. The plant is also noted for its ability to thrive in poor soils, contributing to soil stabilization in degraded landscapes.
